content: Does anyone know why it takes a minute or three for webpages on the nlab to render on firefox?
Maybe this is a feature not a bug. It gives one time to ponder one's decision to visit the nlab and if this is really the right choice to make.
Do you really mean "a minute or three" or is that hyperbole? That sounds extremely unreasonably slow.
Ah, i think when i scroll back and forth it finally renders correctly... so i guess that is a workaround..

Sometimes I find that the math on an nLab page doesn't display properly for me - various symbols are invisible. However, if I select the region of text in question, then the math will render properly. (I'm also on Firefox).

Simon Burton said:

Ah, i think when i scroll back and forth it finally renders correctly... so i guess that is a workaround..

Sometimes the math doesn't render correctly the first time, but it does after I reload.

David Egolf said:

Sometimes I find that the math on an nLab page doesn't display properly for me - various symbols are invisible. However, if I select the region of text in question, then the math will render properly. (I'm also on Firefox).

I can solve this by zooming in and out (ctrl+scroll).
